Reviews.Title: Lots and Lots of Good Stuff Here!  Westinghouse 46" HDTV (#DW46F1Y1): A Critical Review.
Reviews.Author: Andre Lawrence

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_moBQ8E1CONXE6QcurrentClick) { return cv_moBQ8E1CONXE6QcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 6:41 MinsThis was my first tv purchase in almost 7 years. Even when I bought my last tv, it was just months before the broadcasts signals went digital. However, I only used it to watch movies from our dvd and video tape collection. I stopped watching broadcast tv years before.About two months ago, TigerDirect had this HDTV advertised for $399 w/ an additional $50 mail-in-rebate. I bought it on the spot. (Two (2) days later MicroCenter advertised this same set for $350 without the hassle of the m.i.r.)*** *** ***Westinghouse offers several similar 46" HDTV's. So, be careful which one you choose. I don't have any experience with the others so I'm not offering performance-comparison, just the features and the performance of the "DW46F1Y1."*** Inspection ***This tv is relatively lightweight for a big tv. Our UPS carrier, a woman of smaller stature had no problem lifting this big box out of the truck. If I had to guess, it's no more than 30 lbs. And, the weight is evenly balanced, so it doesn't feel heavier than it really is.Viewing angle: 46" diagonally/ 1080P- 120Hz (refresh rate)Height: 24.5"Length: 42"Width: 3.5"Weight: ~30 lbs.Surround Speaker: "TruSound HD Stereo"Bezel: 1" beautiful, black piano-lacquered frameFour (4) Picture modes: User, Standard, Dynamic and MovieFour (4) Audio modes: User, Standard, Movie and MusicLeft side--HDMI port #3Right (Audio) In portLeft (Audio) In portVideo In portBack side--RF- (Radio Frequency) InCoaxial InComponent video output (Y, Pb + Pr)HDMI #2HDMI #1Service In (USB outlet)*** Performance as a secondary computer monitor ***I bought this primarily to serve several functions and not a sole television receiver. Because this HDTV has HDMI built in, I was able to directly connect it to my iMac. This configuration enables me to extend my computer screen landscape by 46". Plus any media, whether native on the harddrive or streaming via an internet connection means, I would have the space and the resolution.As you'll see in the clip, as I worked on the left, I was streaming Terminator 2 from Netflix. The picture was impressive. The native sound on the tv is okay. Just okay. Nothing extraordinary. But, I have a great pair of JBL speakers that I used in place of my computer's native speakers. Because the Westinghouse is now an extension of the computer, the video file streaming from the computer and played on the TV also has the JBL as the default speakers.*** Performance as a HDTV--Playstation 3 ***I don't play games but a neighbor was kind enough to let me borrow his son's PS3 and I played this game for about an hour. In the video, the HD resolution was breathtaking. No lag, no artifacts and the relatively small bezel meant that you had a clean space to work with.*** Performance as a HDTV--films: DVD & Bluray ***If the gameplay was enough to sell me, seeing the difference in my favorite film, The Lord of The Rings as viewed from the standard dvd and the Bluray version, it was a done deal.Even with a Bluray player that upscales dvd's, occasionally, you'll see some residue/ artifacts with films on dvd, however, remastered film on Bluray looks absolutely phenomenal. That's particularly true when comparing the opening sequence of The Two Towers.I apologize for the video clips not being anywhere near capturing the visuals on the tv, I'm working with a small 720 video cam and I'm limited by its capabilities.*** Related recommendations ***MC/ Visa-- Retailers that have a brick and mortal footprint, if the sale price is the sale as their online price and if you pay with a Mastercard or Visa, they (the credit/debit card) company will double the manufacturers warranty under their Buyers Protection clause. So, if you decide on any electronics, it's especially important to keep the receipts.Warranty extra--Inside the bundle, you're encouraged to take out an extended warranty from Square Trade. They said, the offer is good for 30 days, but when I reached Square Trade by phone they actually said, on HDTV's it's 90-days until the insurance offer disappears. So, a three (3) ext warranty for $66 seems like a good deal.*** Conclusion ***+ Versatile as a standalone HDTV, gaming monitor or as external computer monitor.+ Screen is vibrant.+ Very thin bezel.+ 3 HDMI inputs and older ports (for analog equipment)+ 4 preset Visual modes+ 4 preset Audio modes+ Price--keep an eye out for sales, it occasionally drops to $375 (not including s/h)+ Lightweight. Can easily move around.- Speakers could have been better. (Recommend that you purchase a quality 5.1 theatre system, especially for Blu-ray discs.)For a name brand unit that sells for the same price as "no name/ generic" brands, this is an outstanding price. And, the picture is MUCH better than the big box offerings.5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Ug
Reviews.Author: Captredbeard "Techie"
Reviews.Content: Took a chance on this since there are so few reviews out there.1.  Could not activate ATSC tuner.  Why they make you do this is likely to save a buck.  I did it online and it says wrong code.  Then I call and they say I am locked out and they can't unlock me.  It's been three days and no word back from Westinghouse, I have a tv that can't watch tv.2.  All four corners are dark.  My guess is they over-corrected the edge lit issue that make it too light in the corners, but they went too far the other way and now every bright scene has four dark corners for about 2 inches.3.  Stuck on red pixel.I usually buy tv's from local places in case there are problems, now I have a huge tv that is costly to return.  Buyer beware!

Reviews.Title: Westinghouse 46-inch LED HD
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: What promised to be a very nice TV for years to come, turned out to be a complete waste of money. The product quit working after thirteen months, which was conveniently right after the one-year waranty expired. Westinghouse promised to have their customer service people contact me, but they never did; so all I really got after spending a long time working through the automated system was lip service. My recomendation is to avoid Westinghouse TV's and spend a little more for Sony or Samsung.

Reviews.Title: Power Supply Failed-- TV now junk
Reviews.Author: Cara Wilcox "Cara"
Reviews.Content: We bought this TV February of last year.  Exactly 14 months later (just outside our warranty window), the power supply failed on it without warning.  THe TV just turned off and never turned back on again.  We initially bought a new power cord, but it was a component within the TV.  Since the warranty had just expired, we considered a TV repair store, but the cost to replace the defective unit (if that was the case), would have been half the cost of the TV itself, and there was no guarantees it would work even then.I was very disappointed by this-- $500 down the drain. The TV functioned well when it functioned-- clear and nice resolution picture (we never used the sound system). But we should have known better than to go with an "off" brand and skimp on the extended warranty. I guess the 'old fashioned' idea that a company should stand behind a product and replace something that breaks is something from the past.

Reviews.Title: OK
Reviews.Author: Doug Tompkins
Reviews.Content: I bought this TV for my bedroom. For this use it is ok. The picture is ok and it functions well. I would not recommend this unit for areas with allot of sunlight or to be used as a primary unit for the home. For periodic use it serves a purpose but lacks the picture quality you would get with other units. Although the resolution is pretty good the color management of the unit takes a little getting used to.

Reviews.Title: Bad deal !
Reviews.Author: Island Girl
Reviews.Content: Purchased a 46 inch Westinghouse TV (not from Amazon) and it was the worst investment made. It was cheaper than popular brands like LG, Samsung, etc. so I took a chance. The picture quality is poor. My big back old fashioned Toshiba colour TV has better picture quality - by far. With the Westinghouse TV, after about 1 month of use, a line appeared across the screen - which got worse. Tried to get it fixed, and was told that i would need to order a new panel (almost the price of the TV (USD$450 to $500).

Reviews.Title: died after 2 yrs
Reviews.Author: RVHolt
Reviews.Content: We bought our Westinghouse 46" led TV at Sams Club in January of 2012.  The other night it just turned itself off and refused to come on again.  Thankfully we had purchased the service agreement at Sam's and were soon informed that the led panel had died.  The company quickly sent us a check for the amount we spent, and we are in the process of purchasing ANOTHER brand.  I LOVED the image on this set however.  Very sharp colours on HDTV.  Sorry it died.

Reviews.Title: Bought a TV on Amazon
Reviews.Author: Reader
Reviews.Content: I have no complaints about our new TV.  It was totally economical.  It arrived exactly as stated in the tracking emails.  It looks great and is easy to use.  Totally happy.

Reviews.Title: A very good buy
Reviews.Author: Osvaldo J. Alfert
Reviews.Content: I received it sooner than expected. Well packaged.The base was easy to assemble. Setting it up was also very easy.Sound, color, focus up to par. No complains what-so-ever.Will recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: Waste of $. Definitely do not buy.
Reviews.Author: Samuel Langhorn Clemons
Reviews.Content: TV quit working less than 2 years after purchase.  Just flat out died.  Of course Westinghouse and Target offered nothing.  I'm lucky, apparently other people didn't even get nearly 2 years out of it.  Spend a fraction more up front and get a better TV that isn't a lemon.  Do not buy this TV.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Television
Reviews.Author: Patrick Scanlon
Reviews.Content: The speakers are tinny but that can be alleviated with surround sound or a speaker bar.  The big problem is the reliability.  After I first got the television it went belly up after 4 months.  Since it was still under warranty I got a replacement.  That TV went belly up after a year and a half.  With only a one year warranty from Westinghouse I'm sol.  While the price is right the quality just isn't there.

Reviews.Title: garbage tv
Reviews.Author: BRY500S
Reviews.Content: We bought this tv last year and the TV constantly had issues turning on by remote. Then after a year of fighting it it just turned off in the middle of a movie and refused to turn on
